@&#MAIN-TITLE@&#Information granulation and uncertainty measures in interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information systems

@&#HIGHLIGHTS@&#


               highlights
               
                  
                     
                        
                           
                           Operations of IIFGS are proposed.


                        
                        
                           
                           Information granularity is introduced to depict the distinguishment ability of an IIFGS.


                        
                        
                           
                           How to scale the uncertainty of the uncertainty among IIFGSs are discussed.


                        
                        
                           
                           The relationship between entropy and granularity of IIFGSs is discovered.


                        
                     
                  
               
            

@&#KEYPHRASES@&#

Uncertainty modeling

Granular computing

Uncertainty measure

Granularity

Entropy

@&#ABSTRACT@&#


               
               
                  Information granulation and entropy are main approaches for investigating the uncertainty of information systems, which have been widely employed in many practical domains. In this paper, information granulation and uncertainty measures for interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structures are addressed. First, we propose the representation of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granules and examine some operations of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular structures. Second, the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity is introduced to depict the distinguishment ability of an interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular structure (IIFGS), which is a natural extension of fuzzy information granularity. Third, we discuss how to scale the uncertainty of an IIFGS using the extended information entropy and the uncertainty among interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular structures using the expanded mutual information derived from the presented intuitionistic fuzzy information entropy. Fourth, we discovery the relationship between the developed interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information entropy and the intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity presented in this paper.
               
            

@&#INTRODUCTION@&#

Granular Computing has emerged as a unified and coherent platform of constructing, describing, and processing information granules (Zadeh, 1998; Pedrycz, 2012). In GrC, a granule is a set of objects integrated together with the equivalence, indistinguishability, similarity, and proximity of functionality (Pedrycz, 2002; Lin, 2009). The set of granules provides a representation of the unit with respect to a particular level of granularity. The process of constructing information granules is called information granulation, which granulates a universe of discourse into a family of disjoint or overlapping granules. The purpose of GrC is to find an approximation scheme which can effectively solve a complex problem at a certain level of granulation. Since the concept has been proposed, GrC has become a fast growing field of research in recent years (Pedrycz, 2011; Wu and Leung, 2011).

The granulation of objects induced by an equivalent relation is a set of equivalence classes, where each equivalence class can be regarded as an equivalent information granule (Pawlak and Skowron, 2007). Similarly, all tolerance classes induced by a tolerance relation can be seen as the tolerance information granules (Qian et al., 2010). Generally speaking, on the basis of a binary relation (equivalence, similarity, tolerance, dominance, covering-based, neighborhood-based, etc.), one can easily granulate all objects in a crisp information system into a set of information granules, called a binary granular structure (Abo-Tabl, 2011; Dai et al., 2012; Hu et al., 2010; Qian et al., 2011; Skowron et al., 2012). Furthermore, by using a fuzzy binary relation, objects can be granulated into a set of fuzzy information granules, called a fuzzy binary granular structure (Hu et al., 2006, 2007, 2008; Ganivada et al., 2011).

In GrC, an important concept is information granularity of a granular structure, which is a measure of uncertainty about its actual structure. In general, the information granularity represents discernibility ability of information in a granular structure. The smaller the information granularity, the stronger its discernibility ability. How to calculate the information granularity of a granular structure has always been an important issue. Nowadays, several forms of information granularity have been presented according to various views and targets (Qian et al., 2011).

Information entropy and information granularity are two main approaches to measure the uncertainty of a granular structure (Liang and Qian, 2008; Pedrycz, 2011). The entropy of a granular structure, as defined by Shannon (Shannon, 1948), gives a measure of the uncertainty about its actual structure. Because Shannon entropy is defined by the probability of each equivalence class, it cannot be used to measure the uncertainty of a fuzzy granular structure. To overcome this drawback, Hu et al. (2010) extended Shannon entropy to fuzzy-binary granular structures and used this variant to characterize the uncertainty of fuzzy rough sets and fuzzy probability rough sets.


                     Qian et al. (2011) studied fuzzy binary granular structures’ operators and partial order relations, measures for fuzzy information granularity, and axiomatic approach to binary fuzzy information granularity and fuzzy information entropy. Another important mathematical structure that can represent imperfect and/or imprecise information is the intuitionistic fuzzy set (IFS) developed by Atanassov (1986). The IFS is considered a natural extension of Zadeh’s fuzzy sets, and is defined by a pair of membership functions: a fuzzy set provides only the a degree to which an element belongs to a universe, whereas an IFS yields both a membership and a non-membership degree. The membership and non-membership values generate an indeterminacy index that models the hesitancy in deciding the degree to which an object satisfies a particular property. Recently, IFS theory has been successfully applied in decision analysis and pattern recognition (Grzegorzewski, 2011; Wu and Zhang, 2011). In IFS theory, two closed intervals are used so that the subsets of [0,1] can indicate membership and non-membership degrees; Atanassov and Gargov (1989) presented the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy set (IIFS). Can the granulation of objects, partial order relations, uncertainty measures for information granularity in fuzzy information systems be generalized to interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy systems? In this paper, we try to answer this question.

The remainder of the paper is organized as follows. Section 2 briefly introduces the preliminary issues considered in the study, such as the notions of fuzzy binary granular structures and their basic properties, IIFSs and their operations, and then proposes an important concept: cardinality of IIFSs. Section 3 presents interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary relation, operators of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structures and their three partial-order relations. In Section 4, we propose interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity and rough entropy to measure interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structures. In Section 5, we extend Shannon information entropy and information entropy to measure information content of an interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structure, and develop joint entropies, conditional entropies, and mutual information to measure information variation between two interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structures. Finally, Section 6 concludes this paper.

In this section, we first recall some basic concepts, such as fuzzy binary granular structures and their basic properties, IIFSs and their operations, and then define the least, biggest and average cardinality of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy sets.

                                                         S
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               
                                                                  
                                                                     Q
                                                                  
                                                                  
                                                                     ∼
                                                                  
                                                               
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ′

As two generalizations of fuzzy set, IFS and IIFS presented by Atanassov offers a more realistic, practical, and accurate description of the objective world, which makes it very promising. In the following, we recall some basic terms of IFS and IIFS.

                                    .

Given an IFS 
                        
                           
                              
                                 A
                              
                              
                                 ^
                              
                           
                        
                     , Szmidt and Vlachos et al. (Szmidt and Kacprzyk, 2001; Vlachos and Sergiadis, 2007) defined the following three kinds of cardinalities of 
                        
                           
                              
                                 A
                              
                              
                                 ^
                              
                           
                        
                     : the least cardinality, the biggest cardinality and the average cardinality.
                        Definition 9
                        
                           Szmidt and Kacprzyk, 2001; Vlachos and Sergiadis, 2007
                        


                        Let an IFS 
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       A
                                    
                                    
                                       ^
                                    
                                 
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      1
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      +
                                                   
                                                
                                                ,
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      1
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      -
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             x
                                          
                                          
                                             1
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 +
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      2
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      +
                                                   
                                                
                                                ,
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      2
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      -
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             x
                                          
                                          
                                             2
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 +
                                 …
                                 +
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      n
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      +
                                                   
                                                
                                                ,
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      n
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      -
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             x
                                          
                                          
                                             n
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              
                            on U
                           ={x
                           1,
                           x
                           2,…,
                           x
                           
                              n
                           }. Then the least, biggest, and average cardinality of 
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       A
                                    
                                    
                                       ^
                                    
                                 
                              
                            can be calculated as: 
                              
                                 min
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                A
                                             
                                             
                                                ^
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       a
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                    
                                    
                                       +
                                    
                                 
                                 ,
                                 
                                 max
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                A
                                             
                                             
                                                ^
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          1
                                          -
                                          
                                             
                                                a
                                             
                                             
                                                i
                                             
                                             
                                                -
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              
                           , and 
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      A
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      ^
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    
                                       ¯
                                    
                                 
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                a
                                             
                                             
                                                i
                                             
                                             
                                                +
                                             
                                          
                                          +
                                          
                                             
                                                1
                                                -
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      i
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      +
                                                   
                                                
                                                -
                                                
                                                   
                                                      a
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      i
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      -
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                             
                                                2
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       2
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          1
                                          +
                                          
                                             
                                                a
                                             
                                             
                                                i
                                             
                                             
                                                +
                                             
                                          
                                          -
                                          
                                             
                                                a
                                             
                                             
                                                i
                                             
                                             
                                                -
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              
                           .

On the basis of the presented three cardinalities of 
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       A
                                    
                                    
                                       ^
                                    
                                 
                              
                           , we can extend them to interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy settings.

Let an IIFS 
                              
                                 A
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               μ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               A
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               -
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         (
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               x
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               i
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         )
                                                         ,
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               μ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               A
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               +
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         (
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               x
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               i
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         )
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                ,
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               γ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               A
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               -
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         (
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               x
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               i
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         )
                                                         ,
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               γ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               A
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               +
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         (
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               x
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               i
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         )
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             x
                                          
                                          
                                             i
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              
                            on U
                           ={x
                           1,
                           x
                           2,…,
                           x
                           
                              n
                           }, then the least, biggest, and average cardinality of A can be defined as:
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   min
                                                
                                                |
                                                A
                                                |
                                                =
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         ∑
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         i
                                                         =
                                                         1
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         n
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      μ
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      A
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      -
                                                   
                                                
                                                (
                                                
                                                   
                                                      x
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      i
                                                   
                                                
                                                )
                                                ,
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                       
                                          
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   max
                                                
                                                |
                                                A
                                                |
                                                =
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         ∑
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         i
                                                         =
                                                         1
                                                      
                                                      
                                                         n
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                (
                                                1
                                                -
                                                
                                                   
                                                      γ
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      A
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      -
                                                   
                                                
                                                (
                                                
                                                   
                                                      x
                                                   
                                                   
                                                      i
                                                   
                                                
                                                )
                                                )
                                                ,
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                              
                           and
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          |
                                          A
                                          |
                                       
                                       
                                          ¯
                                       
                                    
                                    =
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             ∑
                                          
                                          
                                             i
                                             =

                           The cardinality domain of A can be denoted as the interval: [∣A∣]=[min∣A∣,max∣A∣].


                           If an IIFS A degenerates to an IFS

In GrC, granular structure is a basic term, which can be used to generate new granular structures. Qian et al. (2011) extended four operators and defined three partial order relations on fuzzy binary granular structures. In this section, we intend to construct interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structures and generalize Qian’s four operators and three partial order relations on fuzzy binary granular structures to interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structures.
                        Definition 11
                        Given a universe U
                           ={x
                           1,
                           x
                           2,…,
                           x
                           
                              n
                           }, an interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary relation R on U can be denoted by the following matrix:
                              
                                 
                                    M
                                    (
                                    R

For the sake of simplicity, we also call an interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy binary granular structure as the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular structure (IIFGS) in this paper. Given a family of IIFGSs K(U,
                           Ω) on U
                           ={x
                           1,
                           x
                           2,…,
                           x
                           
                              n
                           }, we can also denote the IIFGS induced by R as

                                    R

                           Let K(P), K(Q), K(R)
                           ∈
                           K(U,
                           
                           Ω), then
                           
                              
                                 (1)
                                 
                                    K(R)∩
                                    K(P)=
                                    K(P)∩
                                    K(R);


                                    K(R)∪
                                    K(P)=
                                    K(P)∪
                                    K(R);


                                    K(R)∩(K(P)∪
                                    K(Q))=(K(P)∩
                                    K(R))∪(K(P)∩
                                    K(Q));


                                    K(R)∪(K(P)∩
                                    K(Q))=(K(P)∪
                                    K(R))∩(K(P)∪
                                    K(Q));

≀(K(R)∩
                                    K(P))=≀K(P)∪≀K(R);

≀(K(R)∪
                                    K(P))=≀K(P)∩≀K(R).

Let K(P), K(Q)∈
                           K(U,
                           Ω), where 
                              
                                 
                                    
                                       S
                                    
                                    
                                       P
                                    
                                 
                                 (
                                 
                                    
                                       x
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                    
                                 
                                 )
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       j
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               a
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               -
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         ,
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               a
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               +
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                ,
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               b
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               -
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         ,
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               b
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               +

Information granularity is the average measure of information (knowledge) granules of a granular structure, which can be used to characterize the distinguishment ability of a granular structure. In interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular structures, an interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity plays the same role, which should also be used to depict the discernibility ability of an IIFGS. In this section, we introduce two measures to evaluate the degree of granulation of an IIFGS: granularity and rough entropy. From the viewpoint of sizes of information granules, we first present a definition of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity of an IIFGS.
                        Definition 18
                        Let 
                              
                                 K
                                 (
                                 R
                                 )
                                 ∈
                                 K
                                 (
                                 U
                                 ,
                                 Ω
                                 )
                                 ,
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       S
                                    
                                    
                                       R
                                    
                                 
                                 (
                                 
                                    
                                       x
                                    
                                    
                                       i
                                    
                                 
                                 )
                                 =
                                 
                                    
                                       ∑
                                    
                                    
                                       j
                                       =
                                       1
                                    
                                    
                                       n
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               μ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               -
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         ,
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               μ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               +
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                                ,
                                                
                                                
                                                   
                                                      
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               γ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               -
                                                            
                                                         
                                                         ,
                                                         
                                                            
                                                               γ
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               ij
                                                            
                                                            
                                                               +
                                                            
                                                         
                                                      
                                                   
                                                
                                             
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                    
                                       
                                          
                                             x
                                          
                                          
                                             i
                                          
                                       
                                    
                                 
                                 
                                 (
                                 1
                                 ⩽
                                 i
                                 ⩽
                                 n
                                 )
                              
                           . The minimum, maximum and average granularity of K(R) can be defined as:

                                                (

                           Let K(P), K(Q)∈

                           2

                           (Q)].


                           Let K(P), K(Q)∈
                           K(U,
                           Ω). If K(P)⪯
                           1
                           K(Q), then [E
                           
                              r
                           (P)]⩽[E
                           
                              r
                           (Q)].

In the framework of fuzzy binary granular structures, Hu et al. (2007, 2008, 2010) extended Shannon’s entropy to a fuzzy (ordinal, neighborhood) granular structure and used this variable to characterize the uncertainty of fuzzy rough sets and fuzzy probability rough sets. Qian et al. (2011) established the relationships among information entropy, rough entropy, and information granularity in fuzzy binary granular structures. Qian et al. (2012) also proved that all information entropies presented by other scholars satisfy the granulation monotonicity of an information granularity. In this section, we discuss how to measure the uncertainty of an IIFGS using entropy and the uncertainty between IIFGSs using mutual information. We also provide the relationship between interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information entropy and interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity.
                        Definition 20
                        
                           Hu et al., 2006

Let K(P), K(Q)∈
                           K(U,
                           Ω). Then, the minimum, maximum, and average joint Shannon information entropy between K(P) and K(Q) are respectively defined as

It is easily proved that the joint Shannon information entropy, Shannon conditional entropy, and Shannon mutual infomation between two IIFGSs are generalizations of joint information Shannon entropy, conditional entropy, and mutual infomation between two fuzzy granular structures (Hu et al., 2006).
                        Theorem 9
                        
                           Let K(P), K(Q)
                           ∈
                           K(U,
                           
                           Ω), then
                           
                              
                                 (1)
                                 if min
                                    H(Q∣P)>0 then min

The proofs of these conclusions are trivial.□


                     Qian et al. (2011) generalized Liang’s information entropy for tolerance granular structures to fuzzy binary granular, which is called fuzzy information entropy.
                        Definition 23
                        
                           Qian et al., 2011
                        


                        Let

On the basis of Qian’s fuzzy information entropy for fuzzy binary granular structures, one can easily defined the mutual information between 
                              
                                 K

                            as follows

In what follows, we generalize Qian’s fuzzy information entropy for fuzzy binary granular structures to interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular ones.

                           One can easily prove that the joint information entropy, conditional entropy, and mutual infomation between two IIFGSs are extensions of those between two fuzzy granular structures (Qian et al., 2011).

The proofs of these conclusions are trivial.□

@&#CONCLUSION@&#

Interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy classification and granulation are important learning tasks in uncertain information processing. Compared with other classification and granulation in various information systems, little attention has been paid to interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy systems. Even though fuzzy information granulation and uncertainty measures for fuzzy information systems have been researched by some scholars, these problems have scarcely been addressed in interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information systems. In this paper, we propose a method for interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granulation and construct three partial order relations on interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granular structures. We also define interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity, rough entropy, Shannon entropy, and information entropy to characterize the uncertainty of interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy granular structures, which are natural extensions of fuzzy information granularity, rough entropy, Shannon entropy, and information entropy. Furthermore, we establish the relationship between the developed interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information entropy and the interval-valued intuitionistic fuzzy information granularity presented in this paper.

@&#ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS@&#

This research was supported by the Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant Nos. 61170105 and 71201076), Jiangsu Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant Nos. BK2009395, BK2011564), and A Project Funded by the Priority Academic Program Development of Jiangsu Higher Education Institutions (Audition Science and Technology).
